ussr.physics
Interface PhysicsSimulation

All Known Implementing Classes:
JMESimulation
public interface PhysicsSimulation

A physics simulation, defined independently of the underlying physics engine. Instances of this interface are created using the PhysicsFactory class. The methods allow simulation parameters to be defined, and to start the simulation running.

Author:
ups

Nested Class Summary
static interface PhysicsSimulation.Handler
          An ultra-simple user-input handler

Method Detail

addInputHandler

void addInputHandler(java.lang.String keyName,
                     PhysicsSimulation.Handler handler)
Define a user input handler for the running simulation, allowing the user to interact with the simulation in a dedicated way. Note that the underlying simulation engine may already define certain keys to certain functions, which may or may not be overridden by this method (the behavior is undefined).

Parameters:
keyName - the name of the key (or key sequence) for which to create an action
handler - an object encapsulating the user-defined action

setRobot

void setRobot(Robot bot)
Define the default robot to be used in this simulation, including visual appearance, physical characteristics, and controller functionality.

Parameters:
bot - the one description of the default robot used in this simulation

setRobot

void setRobot(Robot bot,
              java.lang.String type)
Define the robots to be used in this simulation, including visual appearance, physical characteristics, and controller functionality.

Parameters:
bot - the description of one or more robots used in this simulation

setWorld

void setWorld(WorldDescription world)
Define the world in which the robots are simulation, including starting configuration of the robot and physical obstacles.

Parameters:
world - the descriptoin of the world used for the simulation

start

void start()
Start the simulation

stop

void stop()
Stop the simulation

getModules

java.util.List<Module> getModules()
Get a list containing all the modules currently present in the simulation

Returns:
the modules in the simulation

isPaused

boolean isPaused()
Test whether the simulation is currently paused

Returns:
true is the simulation is paused, false otherwise

isStopped

boolean isStopped()
Test whether the simulation has been stopped

Returns:
true if the simulation has been stopped, false otherwise

getTime

float getTime()
Get the current simulation time

Returns:
the simulation time

setGravity

void setGravity(float g)
Directly set the gravity being used in the simulation. The preferred way of setting the gravity for a simulation is to use PhysicsParameters.setGravity(float)

Parameters:
g - the gravity
See Also:
PhysicsParameters.setGravity(float)

waitForPhysicsStep

void waitForPhysicsStep(boolean notify)
Wait for the physics step to complete by blocking the thread. If notification is requested, all other threads waiting on the simulation object are notified (awakened)

Parameters:
notify - whether to notify other threads or not

subscribePhysicsTimestep

void subscribePhysicsTimestep(PhysicsObserver observer)
Subscribe to the simulation steps, meaning that the observer is notified each time a physics step has been simulated (e.g., at the end of the physics step)

Parameters:
observer - the observer to register for future events
See Also:
PhysicsObserver.physicsTimeStepHook(PhysicsSimulation)

setPause

void setPause(boolean paused)
Set whether the simulation is paused

Parameters:
paused - true if the simulation should be paused, false otherwise

getHelper

PhysicsSimulationHelper getHelper()
Obtain a reference to the simulation helper, which contains various utility methods that work on the simulation

Returns:
a reference to the simulation helper object for this simulation
See Also:
PhysicsSimulationHelper
